strings: <se_low>Yangus: Cor...
<se_low>Yangus: ...Cor...
<se_low>Yangus: I mean...COR!

<se_low>Yangus: It's more amazin' than the castles we was at before.
I dunno wot to say. Cor...

<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus ain't 'ere neither, then.
Where d'ya think 'e's got to?
<se_low>Yangus: Oh, well. I s'pose we better get back an' 'ave a chat wiv Grandad about wot we're gonna do.
<se_low>Yangus: Cor...
<se_low>Yangus: ...Cor...
<se_low>Yangus: I mean...COR!

<se_low>Yangus: It's more amazin' than the castles we was at before.
I dunno wot to say. Cor...
<se_low>Yangus: I 'ate people who mouth off about stuff behind people's backs.

<se_low>Yangus: If you've got some slaggin' off to do, ya come out an' say it straight!
No messin' about. That's wot I say.

<se_high>Jessica: No sign of Dhoulmagus around here.
Where's he hiding?

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let him go!
We have to find him and make him pay for what he's done.
<se_high>Jessica: I've been doing a lot of thinking since we began our journey together.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel like I know so much more about people than I did in Alexandria. I've seen enough hatred and anger and nastiness for a lifetime.
<se_high>Jessica: I swear to the Goddess: however much I change in the days and years ahead, I'll never, ever become like that.

<se_high>Jessica: I really like this kind of place.
It feels like I'm cleansing my soul, or something. It's nice!

<se_high>Jessica: There's so much hatred and negativity around here.
It's really sad.

<se_def>Angelo: I'm not overly fond of places like this.
I'd sooner be in a casino than a church.
I'm more of a player than a prayer.

<se_def>Angelo: What is it?
You can't force a conversation, you know!
<se_def>Angelo: Did you want something?

<se_def>Angelo: Look, I haven't got anything to say, all right?
Stop pestering me for a chat all the time.
It's irritating.

<se_def>Angelo: I'm not overly fond of places like this.
I'd sooner be in a casino than a church.
I'm more of a player than a prayer.

<se_def>Angelo: What is it?
You can't force a conversation, you know!
<se_def>Angelo: Did you want something?

<se_def>Angelo: Look, I haven't got anything to say, all right?
Stop pestering me for a chat all the time.
It's irritating.

<se_low>Yangus: I wouldn't go bellowin' it out or nuffin', but I ain't too fond o' men o' the cloth.
They're all a bit fishy, if you ask me.
<se_low>Yangus: Places like this make me feel queasy.

<se_low>Yangus: Let's go an' 'ave a bit of an 'eave-'o wiv a few monsters, guv!
That's just wot I need right now!

<se_low>Yangus: I wouldn't go bellowin' it out or nuffin', but I ain't too fond o' men o' the cloth.
They're all a bit fishy, if you ask me.
<se_low>Yangus: Places like this make me feel queasy.

<se_low>Yangus: Let's go an' 'ave a bit of an 'eave-'o wiv a few monsters, guv!
That's just wot I need right now!

<se_high>Jessica: Why do people care so much about social climbing that they're willing to pay bribes?
It's all so pointless!

<se_high>Jessica: Customs! Family traditions!
Bah! If you ask me, it's just a lot of meaningless nonsense!
<se_high>Jessica: ...I wonder how Mother is...

<se_high>Jessica: Why do people care so much about social climbing that they're willing to pay bribes?
It's all so pointless!

<se_high>Jessica: Customs! Family traditions!
Bah! If you ask me, it's just a lot of meaningless nonsense!
<se_high>Jessica: ...I wonder how Mother is...

<se_def>Angelo: The church had you sucked in, did it?
You're really far too trusting.
<se_def>Angelo: It's a closed world, the church. Believe me, beyond the locked doors, you'll find a squalid quagmire of ambition, bribery and cruelty.

<se_def>Angelo: But you should know that by now.
You've been travelling with me long enough, haven't you!?

<se_def>Angelo: The church had you sucked in, did it?
You're really far too trusting.
<se_def>Angelo: It's a closed world, the church. Believe me, beyond the locked doors, you'll find a squalid quagmire of ambition, bribery and cruelty.

<se_def>Angelo: But you should know that by now.
You've been travelling with me long enough, haven't you!?
<se_low>Yangus: Urrrrgh!

<se_low>Yangus: I 'ate this feelin'!
It's that Marcello bloke.
He really makes my skin crawl.
<se_low>Yangus: Oooh! I'm all itchy now! Yaaaarrgh!
<se_low>Yangus: Urrrrgh!

<se_low>Yangus: I 'ate this feelin'!
It's that Marcello bloke.
He really makes my skin crawl.
<se_low>Yangus: Oooh! I'm all itchy now! Yaaaarrgh!

<se_high>Jessica: I thought Marcello was a big jerk, but I was wrong.
He's the BIGGEST jerk ever!

<se_high>Jessica: Who does he think he is?
Who gave him the right to treat everyone around him so badly!?

<se_high>Jessica: I thought Marcello was a big jerk, but I was wrong.
He's the BIGGEST jerk ever!

<se_high>Jessica: Who does he think he is?
Who gave him the right to treat everyone around him so badly!?
<se_def>Angelo: Did you want something?

<se_def>Angelo: Look, I haven't got anything to say, all right?
Stop pestering me for a chat all the time.
It's irritating.
<se_def>Angelo: Did you want something?

<se_def>Angelo: Look, I haven't got anything to say, all right?
Stop pestering me for a chat all the time.
It's irritating.

<se_low>Yangus: The cathedral guard's pretty tight, eh?
I don't reckon that dog'd get very far tryin' to force 'is way in 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Them Templars look like a nasty bunch awright, but that prob'ly makes 'em good guards.
<se_high>Jessica: Rhapthorne can start fires, fly through the air, and walk on water... Give him points for versatility.
<se_high>Jessica: Makes you wonder if we can really beat him...

<se_high>Jessica: Oh, sorry! Forget I said that.
There isn't any question <endash> we HAVE to beat him!

<se_def>Angelo: I'm afraid I may well have been right.
That dog, or rather Rhapthorne, is doing just what I feared.
<se_def>Angelo: But even if I'm right and we wanted to get ahead of him, we couldn't.

<se_def>Angelo: It's a shame humans can't fly.
We need the Goddess to give us a piggyback or something.

<se_low>Yangus: That ruddy mutt!
Who's 'e think 'e is, pickin' on 'elpless birds an' nuns an' that!?<page>Yangus: It ain't fair!
Nice, quiet women like that don't stand a chance against 'im!

<se_high>Jessica: So you're saying that it's okay to attack women with a bit of spirit!?
Charming, Yangus! Really charming!
<se_high>Red: Look out, any o' you ladies out there wiv some substance to ya. Old 'alf-'og-'alf-brain 'ere thinks yer fair game for a scrap!

<se_low>Yangus: You wot!? Nah, I didn't mean<endash>
...Argh! Why do birds always get me wrong!?

<se_high>Jessica: Just like we thought, that dog has been here.
We'd better hurry!
<se_high>Jessica: I hate to say this, but it's entirely possible that the next target is already...
Jessica: .........
<se_high>Jessica: ...Already dead.
<se_def>Angelo: Despite appearances, our friend the Lord of Darkness isn't altogether merciless.<page>Angelo: He's never laid a finger on anyone who's not part of his grand plan.
<se_def>Angelo: So I don't think we need fear for the people of Savella. It's the guards at the Lord High Priest's mansion we should be worried for.
<se_def>Angelo: Yes... I'd say they need to watch their backs.

<se_low>Yangus: Guv! Guv! D'you 'ear that!?
We've gotta 'urry!
I've got an 'unch about this!

<se_low>Yangus: I reckon that treasure's gonna be the answer.
It's gonna open the way ahead for us.
<se_low>Yangus: A thief knows these things, guv! Er...I mean, ex-thief. But anyway, we can't afford to 'ang about. We've gotta get goin'!
<se_high>Jessica: Even the tiniest scrap of information could prove useful to us.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go and find that pirate treasure!
<se_def>Angelo: Yes, I know exactly what you're going to say.
<se_def>Angelo: You want to go treasure-hunting. Correct?

<se_def>Angelo: Well if it leads us to the Godbird Empyrea, fantastic. And if not, well...
You can't beat worldly wealth, can you?

<se_def>Angelo: So what are we chatting about it for!?
Let's get going!

<se_low>Yangus: The cathedral guard's pretty tight, eh?
I don't reckon that dog'd get very far tryin' to force 'is way in 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Them Templars look like a nasty bunch awright, but that prob'ly makes 'em good guards.
<se_high>Jessica: I didn't realise it before, but this is really a beautiful cathedral.
<se_high>Jessica: Hey, <hero>?
<se_high>Jessica: When this is all over, why don't we all go on a trip together? We can use the ship to go sightseeing! What do you think?

<se_high>Jessica: But I suppose we've got to finish the job before we think about that.
Let's take care of that black dog!
<se_def>Angelo: Sure, why not!? After all, what better place to come than a cathedral if you want to pray for the Goddess's protection on your journey?

<se_def>Angelo: What's wrong with you!?
I don't know whether you're a devout believer or just a coward!<page>Angelo: Either way, praying will get you nowhere, I can assure you.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm sure of it, guv.
That mutt'll be goin' for the Lord 'Igh Priest's place above 'ere.

<se_low>Yangus: But 'ow are we gonna get up there?
They ain't gonna let us use that weird lift thing, are they?

<se_low>Yangus: So wot are we gonna do?
We've gotta get up there before the dog comes along. But 'ow?

<se_high>Jessica: The black dog is still prowling around here.
That must mean it hasn't had time to carry out its mission yet.
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better find it and stop it while we still have a chance.

<se_def>Angelo: Don't forget, there are rumours flying around as well as a big black dog.
And rumours travel pretty fast.<page>Angelo: Marcello will be ready for it.
The Lord High Priest will be well guarded.

<se_def>Angelo: But still, the enemy is a bloodthirsty monster.
We haven't got time to hang around.
Not if we want to keep the death toll down.
<se_low>Yangus: Ah! I know!

<se_low>Yangus: Er... Ain't it?
...Er...'ang on a minute, guv.
It's comin' to me...
<se_low>Yangus: Er... Um...

<se_low>Yangus: Nah...sorry, guv.
I thought I 'ad it, but it's gone now.
Come on, then. Best not waste time, eh?
<se_high>Jessica: Lorenzo!? What's HE doing here!?
<se_high>Jessica: ...Actually, though, those pennants aren't too bad!

<se_def>Angelo: So, who's that?
At a glance, he looks almost presentable.<page>Angelo: But upon closer inspection, he's just the wrong side of characterful, perhaps a touch...hideous.

<se_def>Angelo: Ah, it's Lorenzo!
I don't know what it is about him, but...I could really thump the man!

<se_low>Yangus: There's nuffin' like dreamin'!
Sounds like 'e's 'avin' a good'un an' all!

<se_high>Jessica: Good grief! I don't even want to know what he's dreaming about.
Talk about not getting the hint!

<se_high>Jessica: I feel...dirty!
Come on, let's get out of here.

<se_def>Angelo: So, who's that?
At a glance, he looks almost presentable.<page>Angelo: But upon closer inspection, he's just the wrong side of characterful, perhaps a touch...hideous.

<se_def>Angelo: Ah, it's Lorenzo!
I don't know what it is about him, but...I could really thump the man!

<se_low>Yangus: I've got a bad feelin' comin' over me, guv!
Very bad!

<se_low>Yangus: That mutt's around 'ere somewhere, for sure.
We'll 'ave a betta chance o' findin' 'im from up in the sky, though. Come on!
<se_low>Yangus: I was a bit careless before, but nuffin' gets past ol' Yangus more than once!
<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv! Let's sock it to that miserable mongrel once an' for all!

<se_high>Jessica: I've got pins and needles all over!
There's some kind of wicked spell surrounding this area...!
<se_high>Jessica: We need to exercise extreme caution from now on. The slightest mistake could prove deadly.
<se_high>Jessica: I'm so angry, I can't stop shaking.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't afford to let it strike again!
I won't PERMIT it to strike again!<page>Jessica: No more death and suffering!
We have to stop that damn dog!
<se_def>Angelo: There's a really foul taste in the air now.

<se_def>Angelo: I don't know what it is.
A monster, perhaps?
Or Rhapthorne?
<se_def>Angelo: Whatever it is, it doesn't matter. Our objective now is to find that dog and teach it how to play dead...convincingly.
<se_def>Angelo: We don't have much choice.

<se_low>Yangus: Our enemy's in Neos, guv.
There ain't no point bein' 'ere now.
Come on!

<se_low>Yangus: Seein' all these people 'ere in mournin' makes ya quite upset, don't it?
I can feel the tears wellin' up.
<se_low>Yangus: Just reminds me 'ow we couldn't do nuffin' to 'elp.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't care how many times he knocks me down, I'll just keep on getting up again!
I'll never give up! Ever!

<se_high>Jessica: <Cap><hero>!
Let's go back to the Holy Isle of Neos!
We have to defeat Rhapthorne!

<se_high>Jessica: My guess is that the sceptre has fallen into Marcello's hands.
I can't be sure, but...call it a hunch.

<se_high>Jessica: Anyway, he isn't here.
Nowhere near here.
He's somewhere far, far away.
<se_def>Angelo: If we let him go now, he'll get himself established as the Lord High Priest.<page>Angelo: His guard will be so tight, we won't stand a chance of getting near him.
<se_def>Angelo: We've got one shot at defeating Marcello, and it's now. Let's go!

<se_def>Angelo: This time we've got to stop him.
Whatever happens.

<se_high>Jessica: Everyone's still grieving over the death of the Lord High Priest.
It's so sad around here.
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the power to do something to cheer them up. Something to make them feel better. So let's do it.
<se_low>Yangus: Wiv all them nuns an' monks an' that prayin' away, this church'll be awright, I reckon.

<se_low>Yangus: But a monster swoopin' down from the sky could still upset things a bit.
We've gotta put Rhapthorne out the picture.

<se_def>Angelo: I've no idea if their prayers will be heard or not, but the cathedral will be fine, I'm sure.<page>Angelo: It's built on solid foundations<endash> Hm?
No, not faith! Rock!
<se_def>Angelo: There might be a lot of broken glass to clear up, but no one's life is in danger.
<se_def>Angelo: Whether you've faith in the Goddess or not, we're all going to need a prayer to make it through this.
<se_high>Jessica: All we need to do is play the echo flute to see if there are any orbs in the area.
<se_high>Jessica: But I wouldn't feel right, playing a musical instrument in the middle of a place where everyone is praying!
<se_low>Yangus: Wiv all these people about, there'd prob'ly be quite a fuss if there was an orb shinin' away somewhere.
<se_low>Yangus: So I reckon there prob'ly ain't one 'ere. That's my theory anyway.
<se_def>Angelo: Seven's a kind of holy number, isn't it? People say it's a number representing the Goddess's power.
<se_def>Angelo: I'd wager it's no coincidence that there were seven great sages. And seeing as we're fighting their cause now, I'd say that means we can't lose. The Goddess is on our side!

<se_high>Red: Savella...
Blimey, this place is somefin' else, eh?
One o' the crown jewels o' the church!
<se_high>Red: Shame there ain't no way to 'alf-inch a buildin'...

<se_high>Red: It's a funny old world the 'ighfalutin lot live
in, eh? I dunno who ya can trust an' who ya can't, person'ly. Not that I'm bothered about findin' out.

<se_high>Red: But I'll say one thing. Mouthin' off be'ind people's backs don't get ya nowhere, never!
Just shows you up to be a gutless loser.
<se_low>Morrie: How does it make you feel when you visit the Savella Cattedrale, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: When I laid my eyes in it for the first time, I was so moved with emozione, I just gazed up at the magnifico building for ages in ages.
<se_low>Morrie: For two holy hours after, I could not make my head go down! ...Si, I can laugh now, but it was not so funny at the time, ay? Ah ha ha!
<se_low>Morrie: ...Maybe we pretend we don't hear this? Water in the mouth, ay?
<se_high>Red: Wot a travesty, eh? This beautiful church bein' run by a bunch o' crooks.
<se_high>Red: Wot the church needs 'ere is someone wiv a bit o' moral fibre. Someone trustworthy, to do things right. Ya know, someone like me.
<se_high>Red: ...Heh heh, blimey, ya didn't think I was bein' serious, did ya?
<se_low>Morrie: Such a magnifico cattedrale! But the beauty is ruinated by the black hearts of the people working here, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: When the boys become the men, they lose their innocenza. This is the problemo. We must all try to keep our pure hearts. Like me! Everyone must take a leak out on my book!
<se_low>Morrie: Si, take a leak on the book of Moro Mozzarella!
<se_def>Angelo: Marrie warned me about your propensity to have things a little...skewed, Morrie. And she asked me to set you straight on such occasions.

<se_def>Angelo: Now, far be it from me to disregard a special request from a beautiful young maiden, but...
I really haven't the heart. So just stop, would you? Just...stop.
<se_high>Red: The bloke's got a bit of a nerve, ain't it, pickin' a fight wiv all of us?
<se_high>Red: He'll soon be wishin' 'e 'adn't put me nose outta joint, I can tell ya. That creepy face of 'is is just beggin' to be smacked!

<se_low>Morrie: Hmph, we make no notice, ay? Maybe this ragazzo has the bad day with words.
I think what he means is...‘Ciao’!
<se_high>Red: The big black mutt was comin' over this way, right?
<se_high>Red: But it can't o' got 'ere yet. I mean, if people 'ad seen a flyin' dog, they'd be talkin' about it all over the shop, right?
<se_low>Morrie: We do not know what the black canine is gonna do next, ay? But the beast can fly in the sky. How can we defeat it?
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe if we could fly, too. But how...?
<se_high>Red: So the mutt's been 'ere, eh? But it ain't done nuffin' yet. Sounds to me like it's been scoutin' out the place. Gettin' the lie o' the land.

<se_high>Red: I say we keep a close eye on Savella.
Somefin's gonna go down 'ere, I can feel it.

<se_low>Morrie: If the canine is coming here once, he will
be back! Si, you know what they say, ay?
The criminali, they always come back to
be seen at the crime!
<se_high>Red: I dunno about them Templars. I wouldn't trust 'em any further than I could throw 'em. Their captain's that Marcello bloke for starters, right?
<se_high>Red: Nah, there's somefin' not right about the lot of 'em, if you ask me. I mean, 'ave ya noticed 'ow all of 'em 'ave got really long boats?
<se_low>Morrie: If the Templars are here guarding the cattedrale, we have nothing to worry on, ay? We can get along with our quest!
<se_high>Red: Blimey, that mutt don't give up, eh? So now it's after the Lord 'Igh Priest, is it?
<se_high>Red: Come on, we've gotta beat 'im to it! ...I mean, it to 'im. No time for gabbin' now. To the Lord 'Igh Priest's mansion!
<se_low>Morrie: The canine is heading to the building behind the cattedrale! But they do not let us to go there, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe we have to climb on the outside of the lift!
<se_high>Red: Who's that geezer then, eh? He's utterly splen<->different, that's for sure. Blimey, wot a ponce!
<se_high>Red: One o' your mates, is 'e, <hero>?

<se_high>Red: ...Oh yeah? Jessica gets around, dun't she, eh?
Hmph, rather 'er than me...
<se_high>Red: ...Nah, ya don't know 'im? Shame, I thought there was gonna be a yarn there an' I was lookin' forward to gettin' all the juicy details.

<se_low>Morrie: This young ragazzo is looking good, ay?
A man in my own heart!

<se_low>Morrie: But he has still the things to learn. Allora,
I, Moro Mozzarella, will teach him my most fantastico fashion secrets! Si, I have my finger on the pus of the world of fashion!

<se_high>Red: Listen to 'im gabbin' on in 'is sleep!
How about we get a bit lib'ral wiv a pen
an' draw on 'is mush, eh?

<se_high>Red: We could do 'im a few favours. Make 'is face
as fancy as 'e seems to think 'is clobber is.
<se_low>Morrie: Attenzione! No one is saying so much in their sleep! He is trying to trick us! Waiting to attack!

<se_low>Morrie: ..................
Or, or maybe he is sleeping like the bambino.
...Scusi.
<se_high>Red: I got a chill down me spine all of a sudden just then. We're 'eadin' into trouble, I reckon.
<se_high>Red: That big black mutt ain't too far away, I'd put dosh on it. Keep yer eyes peeled, ev'ryone.
<se_high>Red: We lost that cos we weren't tough enough. No two ways about it, unfortunately.
<se_high>Red: But we're on the up, eh? Gettin' tougher all the time. So it ain't gonna go that way next time, right? We're gonna teach that mutt a lesson!

<se_low>Morrie: Si... Si... I smell it on the wind! The scent
of the monster! The black canine is near.
Si, Moro knows he smells!
<se_low>Morrie: No! How can we lose?
<se_low>Morrie: Va bene! This is just the warming up, ay? In the next fight, we pull out all the shops!
<se_high>Red: That Marcello didn't look like 'e was bein' controlled like wot the dog was.
<se_high>Red: I'm thinkin' maybe that's 'is true colours, eh? Yeah, 'is true, stark ravin' bonkers colours.

<se_high>Red: This ain't no time for a chat! Blimey lummy!
The last o' the sages' heirs just got bumped
off, right?
<se_high>Red: That means the Lord o' Darkness is about to resurrect 'imself! We got more important things to be doin' than 'avin' a chinwag!
<se_low>Morrie: Is it the power of the sceptre that is so strong, or the power of signor Marcello...?
<se_low>Morrie: Whatever is the answer, we must be stronger, ay! We must have more POWER, more GUSTO and more PASSION!
<se_low>Morrie: So many people are <endash> How do you say it? <endash> ‘doing the dumps’ because of the death of the Lord High Priest, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: We must bring the killer to justice! Make the canine pay for this stinky business it is doing! This is the duty of the legendary heroes!
<se_high>Red: I dunno if the Lord 'Igh Priest woulda wanted ev'ryone to be mournin' all this time.

<se_high>Red: But I guess that's just my take on it, eh?
Some people need to 'ave a good mourn to
get stronger, I s'pose.
<se_low>Morrie: Lord High Padre! We do not stop until we have brong the Rhapthorne to his kneeses! Si...

<se_low>Morrie: This we swear with ALL our PASSION and GUSTOOOoooOOO! ...Allora, now we are
pomped up and ready to go, ay?
